page.title: 17KEMBLE AERODROME
page.content: {Kemble Aerodrome}was opened in 1939. It was owned by the{RAF.}In 1984, the {Americans}came and took over most of it. There is a British C.O. and an American C.O. The British and the Americans work very closely together. The main work of the base is maintenance and storage. Many people are employed there. Among the planes which we can see landing at Kemble Aerodrome are A 10, F 5, Heron 135, E 15 Eagle, Hercules and Devon 75. The runway is 6550 feet long. There are 14 hangars. Some are used by the British but most by the Americans.
